```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggthemes)
library(dplyr)

dryadData <- read.table("Data/veysey-babbitt_data_amphibians.csv", header=TRUE, sep=",", stringsAsFactors = TRUE)

dryData <- filter(dryadData, species == "RASY")

dryestData <- mutate(dryData, ratio = No.recap/count.total.adults)

newData <- dryestData %>%
  group_by(treatment) %>%
  summarize(average_ratio = mean(ratio, na.rm=TRUE))

#in the factor function it reassigns different names for them when specify label and levels specification changes the order 

newData$treatment <- factor(newData$treatment, 
            levels=c("Reference",
                     "100m", "30m"))

# use dplyr to simplify the data set use the filter and mutate function



p <- ggplot(data=newData, aes(x=treatment, y=average_ratio)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", color="black") 
  ylab("Proportion of recaptured wood frogs") +
  scale_x_discrete(labels=c("Reference", "100m", "30m")) +
  theme_few() + scale_fill_grey() + 
  theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = 'gray94', color = 'black'), legend.position="top",  legend.title= element_blank(), axis.title.y = element_text(size=12, face="bold", colour = "black"), strip.text.y = element_text(size = 10, face="bold", colour = "black")) 
p
```
